TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TestFlow extends System.Object

Docs.summary: A mock channel that can be used for unit testing of bot logic.
Docs.remarks: You can use this class to mimic input from a a user or a channel to validate that the bot or adapter responds as expected.

Docs.param: The exchange to add to the exchanges in the existing flow.
The flow to build up from. This provides the test adapter to use, the bot turn processing locig to test, and a set of exchanges to model and test.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from an existing flow.

Docs.param: The expected activity from the bot.
A message to send if the actual response is not as expected.
The amount of time in milliseconds within which a response is expected.
Docs.summary: Adds an assertion that the turn processing logic responds as expected.
Docs.returns: A new object that appends this assertion to the modeled exchange.
Docs.remarks: This method does not modify the original object.
Docs.exception: The bot did not respond as expected.

Public Function StartTestAsync () As Task

Docs.summary: Starts the execution of the test flow.
Docs.returns: Runs the exchange between the user and the bot.
Docs.remarks: This methods sends the activities from the user to the bot and checks the responses from the bot based on the activiies described in the current test flow.

Docs.param: The list of activities to test.
A message to send if the actual response is not as expected.
The amount of time in milliseconds within which a response is expected.
Docs.summary: Shorcut for adding an arbitray exchange between the user and bot. Each activity with a . equals to "bot" will be processed with the method. Every other activity will be processed as user's message via the method.
Docs.returns: A new object that appends this exchange to the modeled exchange.
Docs.remarks: This method does not modify the original object.
Docs.exception: The bot did not respond as expected.
